title: IST Startup Week
location: Penn State College of Information Sciences and Technology
desc:
April 11-15, Silicon Valley comes to Happy Valley! 

IST Startup Week returns with speakers and CEOs from Reddit, Weebly, Twitch, Teespring, Cruise Automation, Stealth Startup, Verizon, POLITICO and more. 

All events are free and open to the public! Can’t make it to campus? Watch Startup Week online at: http://startupweek.weebly.com

title: IST Fall Open House
location: Penn State College of Information Sciences and Technology
desc:
Registration is now OPEN for IST's Fall Open House! http://bit.ly/1YvU6oD

Join us for a great opportunity to learn about the doors an IST education will open. With $70.2 million in research funding, IST's average undergraduate career placement since 2007 is 86%.

Register here: http://bit.ly/1YvU6oD
Or via "tickets available" link at top of page.

title: PSU Panel Talk: Alumni Making an Impact at the Region's Hottest Tech Companies
desc:
For DC-metro IST alumni:

On behalf of the IST Alumni Society, you are invited to join Penn State's Smeal Club DC on the evening of May 12th at Clyde’s of Tysons Corner for a panel-style discussion showcasing Penn State alumni playing significant roles at some of the region’s hottest technology companies.  RSVP now at the following link; space is limited! http://bit.ly/1gWjjzg
 
The panel discussion will be moderated by Penn State alumni Gene Riechers, vice chairman at EverFi, a leading education technology company. Gene is also the co-founder of Valhalla Partners, one of the leading venture capital firms in the Mid-Atlantic region.  Panelists will include:
 
-Linda Abraham – Founder & EVP, Global Development at comScore
-AJ Gollinger – Controller at Alarm.com
-Tom Hahn – VP Finance & Administration at Orchestro
-Ryan Healy – COO & Founder at Brazen Careerist
-Joe Zaczyk – Controller at CustomInk
 
This event will be sponsored by Ernst & Young (EY) and MorganFranklin Consulting.

title: IST Start-up Week 2014
desc:
April 7-11, 2014

A week-long showcase of innovation and entrepreneurship for students to challenge their minds to think more broadly in whatever career path they choose. 

Open to the Penn State community and beyond! Come in person or watch online in real time at ist.psu.edu/startup.

Visit http://bit.ly/ISTstartup for schedule, speaker line-up, photos and more!

title: IST Diplomats Leadership Academy Information Session
desc:
Please RSVP in Compass for the Information Session, under the EVENTS tab (https://ist-psu-csm.symplicity.com/)

We are going to have an informal talk over pizza and refreshments to discuss IST Diplomats Leadership Academy, and answer any questions you may have. There will be some students who are currently going through the program to talk about their experiences!

Applications are now open for the 2014-2015 IST Diplomats Leadership Academy class. We had a successful first year and are excited to identify additional talented and enthusiastic students. As you know, this program enhances the current IST Diplomats outreach efforts by adding an academic component that focuses on developing vital leadership skills. 

If you meet the following criteria and are interested, apply at http://ist.psu.edu/current-students/student-organizations/2012-ist-diplomat-application
•	Are resident full-time undergraduate students in the College of Information Sciences and Technology, University Park campus. 
•	Have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. 
•	Be able to communicate clearly and articulately 
•	Sophomore standing or above in Fall 2014. 
•	Be highly motivated, enthusiastic, dependable, knowledgeable, and sincere in representing Penn State and the College of Information Sciences and Technology. 
•	Be a University Park Student for at least one semester. 

If you have any questions, please let us know by emailing leadership@ist.psu.edu.

Please join us on Monday, November 11, 2013 from 6:00-7:30 p.m. in 202 IST.  Food will be provided!

title: Weiqi (围棋, the Game of Go), Sun Tzu, and the Chinese Way of War (10/24)
desc:
ABSTRACT

Weiqi, or the game of Go, is a Chinese-invented board game. It is the world’s oldest board game; yet still arguably the most sophisticated and challenging one. In many ways, this game is a living reflection of Chinese culture, philosophy, strategic thinking, and operational art.

Most sports and games find their origins in human conflict. They turn deadly human confrontations into regulated competitions. The Olympic Games are prime examples. Weiqi is no exception.
Once created, sports and games also become part of culture. Culture influences human thinking and behavior in many ways. American football, for instance, finds its expressions in U.S. national security decision-making, diplomatic interactions, and above all, military undertakings. Weiqi as a Chinese cultural artifact is intrinsically connected to Sun Tzu’s Art of War and the Chinese way of war.

The presentation on Weiqi, Sun Tzu, and the Chinese Way of War will highlight the fundamentals of the Chinese strategic culture, Sun Tzu’s Art of War, and uses Weiqi to illustrate the Chinese way of strategic thinking and operational art.

DR. DAVID LAI

Dr. David Lai is a Research Professor of Asian Security Affairs at the Strategic Studies Institute (SSI) of the U.S. Army War College (USAWC). Before joining SSI, Dr. Lai was on the faculty of the U.S. Air War College. Born and raised in China, Lai witnessed China’s “Cultural Revolution,” its economic reform, and changes in China’s foreign relations, the most important of all, U.S.-China relations.

Dr. Lai will also be speaking at 6:30 p.m. on Oct. 24th in the Lewis Katz Building on the topic, “U.S.-China Relations and the Chinese Way of War.”

title: First Annual Undergraduate Research Symposium
desc: IST's Office of Undergraduate Studies is hosting the 1st Annual Undergraduate Research Symposium to celebrate the accomplishments of eight IST Undergraduate Student Research Fellowship recipients who worked with a faculty supervisor this past summer. Conference-style lectures will be presented by these students. Refreshments will be served.

title: Teaching Technology for Social Justice, with Dr. Lynette Kvasny
desc:
A George McMurtry Lecture
**********************
ABSTRACT

As an educator, my objective is to raise students’ consciousness of both the opportunities and problems that arise from our world’s growing reliance on information and communication technology (ICT). I do so by bringing a social justice perspective to the study of ICT and society. 

According to Adams, Bell and Griffin (1997), social justice education utilizes experiential pedagogical principles that help students to understand power relations expressed in oppressive systems that incite feelings of marginalization, exploitation of labor, threats of violence, cultural imperialism, and feelings of powerlessness. As students apply these themes to familiar ICTs and their digital culture, they become conscious of their operating worldview and are able to examine alternative ways of understanding the world and social relations. 

Social justice education has the potential to prepare students to become something more than technologists who are able to effectively design, implement and manage information systems. They are becoming people who are sophisticated in their understanding of social interactions amongst diverse groups, and are able to critique current technology arrangements and envision new possibilities for ICT and society.

ABOUT LYNETTE KVASNY

Lynette Kvasny, associate professor of Information Sciences and Technology, received her Ph.D. in Computer Information Systems from the Robinson College of Business, Georgia State University. Her research focuses on how and why historically underserved groups appropriate information and communication technologies.

Lynette Kvasny is creative and tireless in her selection and integration of real world examples of information and communication technology into her teaching activities. In courses ranging from freshman seminars to doctoral research foundations, she guides her students to recognize and articulate how technologies that they often take for granted are having powerful effects on individuals, social groups, organizations and cultures.

title: College Dean's Meeting
desc:
This meeting is for first year students admitted either summer or fall, juniors who transferred into the College of IST from other majors, colleges, or campuses, and all new international and exchange students.

Information will be provided regarding college-specific student program and service opportunities.  You will have an opportunity to:

   -- Explore the IST online career posting system Compass with a Career Solutions staff member
    --Talk with IST student government officers about how to get involved in IST clubs and organizations
    --Join current students for an ice cream social immediately following the program

There is no need to register for this event; we have plenty of ice cream for everyone!

title: McMurtry Award Lecture with Col. Jake Graham
desc:
First Annual McMurtry Award Lecture to be given by Jake Graham, Professor of Practice in Security and Risk Analysis, and 2011-12 recipient of the George J. McMurtry Excellence in Teaching and Learning Faculty Enhancement Fund. 

Graham will speak about "Using analytic decision games to teach security and risk analysis in the college classroom."  

For more info, visit: ist.psu.edu/events

The College of IST offers three unique bachelor's degrees:

    B.S. in Information Sciences and Technology

Our graduates enjoy among the highest placement rates and starting salaries at Penn State.

title: Parents & Families Day
desc:
The faculty and staff from the College of Information Sciences and Technology (IST) invite you and your family to join us for Parents & Families Day. During this event, you will have the opportunity to:

    * Learn about what is new in our IST and SRA majors.

Registration is requested by September 9. To register, visit https://www.cvent.com/events/parents-families-day/registration-9ed4269b601342519f19fc5b1eb81bc2.aspx.

Come on out for games, prizes, and FREE FOOD!

Find out more about IST student organizations at: http://ist.psu.edu/current-students/student-organizations

title: IST talk:  Informal Animation Sketching with K-Sketch
desc:
Abstract:
Informal interfaces capture ideas in natural expressive forms, such as sketching and speaking, to avoid the burden of specifying precise details. Animation is a perfect test bed for informal interfaces, because it is a powerful expressive medium, but current animation tools are either too restrictive or too complex. K-Sketch is a “kinetic” sketch pad for informal animation that allows users to create simple animations quickly and easily with sketching and hand gestures. To design K-Sketch, I analyzed 72 usage scenarios with a novel conceptual modeling technique called interface optimization. In this talk, I will present the K-Sketch interface and explain how interface optimization was used during the design process. I will also describe laboratory studies that show significant improvements over existing tools, show how K-Sketch is being used by both educators and designers, and explain how it is being extended to support prototyping of more polished animations and video games.
 
Bio:
Richard Davis is an Assistant Professor of Information Systems at Singapore Management University specializing in Human-Computer Interaction. The goal of his research is to create user interfaces that fit organically into human life and feel like a natural extension of the human mind and body. Much of his work focuses on creative tools for novices and professional designers. Richard completed his bachelors and masters degrees in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (with a minor in Theater Arts) at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1995. He then worked on creative tools in industry (at Intel, mimio, BorisFX, and The MathWorks) before completing his Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of California, Berkeley in 2008. He currently resides in Singapore. More information on his current and past projects is available at www.richardcdavis.com

title: IST Spring Picnic sponsored by PricewaterhouseCoopers
desc: Join us for free Clem's BBQ, music and open mic entertainment! All of the IST community is welcome!

title: Colloquium Guest Speaker Dr. Anurag Acharya
desc:
Don't miss the last Colloquium of the semester!

Google Scholar: The Adventure Continues

Google Scholar is a fresh look at the traditional problem of searching
for scholarly literature. We started down this road several years ago
with a simple-to-state goal - researchers everywhere should be able to
find  relevant work done by colleagues anywhere, Like all
simple-to-state goals, it came with many challenges. Dr. Acharya will describe the underlying principles and key features of Google Scholar and the approach to some of the challenges.
